Key Match Events: Trent Alexander-Arnold scored a sublime volley to add a goal late in the match
Cole Palmer scored a penalty to break the deadlock
Harry Kane added a third goal late in the match
Pre-Game Insights: Gareth Southgate emphasized the importance of controlling midfield possession
The England team news included Cole Palmer and Eberechi Eze starting for the first time
Harry Kane was set to start, but came on as a substitute
Marc Guehi is expected to start the Euro 2024 opener against Serbia
Harry Kane and Jude Bellingham were rested for the match
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate praised the team's performance, acknowledging the need for improvement in the first half
Eberechi Eze expressed gratitude for the opportunity and enjoyment of the game
Ian Ladyman mentioned that the match felt like an audition night for several starters
Trent Alexander-Arnold performed well and showed promise in midfield
Harry Kane expressed satisfaction with his performance and the team's preparation
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at St James' Park
The weather was good with the sun shining and no reports of rain or other adverse conditions
The match was a friendly ahead of Euro 2024
Trent Alexander-Arnold's performance was noted as a potential starting spot at Euro 2024
Others: The match was the first time England would face Bosnia and Herzegovina
Cole Palmer's performance was exceptional and he scored his first goal for England
Harry Kane now has 63 goals for England, breaking Wayne Rooney's record
Marc Guehi is set to start against Serbia due to Harry Maguire's injury
